title: The Shawshank Redemption
synopsis: The Shawshank Redemption is a 1994 American drama film written and directed by Frank Darabont, based on the 1982 Stephen King novella Rita Hayworth and Shawshank Redemption. It stars Tim Robbins as Andy Dufresne, a banker who is sentenced to life in Shawshank State Penitentiary for the murder of his wife and her lover, despite his claims of innocence. During his time at the prison, he forms a friendship with a fellow inmate, Ellis Boyd 'Red' Redding, played by Morgan Freeman, and becomes involved in a money-laundering operation.

title: The Godfather
synopsis: The Godfather is a 1972 American crime film directed by Francis Ford Coppola and produced by Albert S. Ruddy, based on Mario Puzo's best-selling novel of the same name. The film stars Marlon Brando as Vito Corleone, the head of a powerful New York crime family, and Al Pacino as his son Michael Corleone, who takes over the family business. The Godfather is widely regarded as one of the greatest films in the history of cinema, and has had a significant impact on popular culture.

title: Pulp Fiction
synopsis: Pulp Fiction is a 1994 American crime film written and directed by Quentin Tarantino. It stars John Travolta, Uma Thurman, Samuel L. Jackson, Bruce Willis, and Ving Rhames. The film tells several interconnected stories about crime in Los Angeles, including the story of a hitman, a boxer, and two small-time criminals. Pulp Fiction is known for its nonlinear narrative structure, eclectic soundtrack, and memorable dialogue.

title: The Dark Knight
synopsis: The Dark Knight is a 2008 superhero film directed by Christopher Nolan and based on the DC Comics character Batman. It is the sequel to 2005's Batman Begins and stars Christian Bale as Batman, alongside Heath Ledger as the Joker. The film follows Batman as he tries to stop the Joker from wreaking havoc on Gotham City. The Dark Knight received critical acclaim for its performances, screenplay, and dark tone.

title: Fight Club
synopsis: Fight Club is a 1999 film directed by David Fincher and based on the 1996 novel of the same name by Chuck Palahniuk. It stars Brad Pitt, Edward Norton, and Helena Bonham Carter. The film follows an insomniac office worker who forms an underground fight club as a form of therapy. Fight Club explores themes of masculinity, consumerism, and identity.

title: Inception
synopsis: Inception is a 2010 science fiction action film written and directed by Christopher Nolan. The film stars Leonardo DiCaprio as a professional thief who steals information by infiltrating the subconscious of his targets. Inception explores the concept of shared dreaming and features stunning visual effects. The film received critical acclaim for its originality and complex storytelling.

title: The Matrix
synopsis: The Matrix is a 1999 science fiction action film written and directed by the Wachowskis. It stars Keanu Reeves, Laurence Fishburne, Carrie-Anne Moss, and Hugo Weaving. The film depicts a dystopian future in which reality is simulated by a computer program called the Matrix. The Matrix received widespread acclaim for its innovative visual effects and philosophical themes.

title: Forrest Gump
synopsis: Forrest Gump is a 1994 American comedy-drama film directed by Robert Zemeckis and based on the 1986 novel of the same name by Winston Groom. The film stars Tom Hanks as Forrest Gump, a slow-witted but kind-hearted man who witnesses and unwittingly influences several historical events in the 20th century. Forrest Gump received critical acclaim for its performances, screenplay, and emotional depth.

title: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring
synopsis: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring is a 2001 epic fantasy adventure film directed by Peter Jackson. It is the first installment in The Lord of the Rings film trilogy, based on J.R.R. Tolkien's novel of the same name. The film follows a group of hobbits, elves, dwarves, and men who form a fellowship to destroy a powerful ring and save Middle-earth from the dark lord Sauron. The Fellowship of the Ring received critical acclaim for its visual effects, storytelling, and ensemble cast.

title: The Silence of the Lambs
synopsis: The Silence of the Lambs is a 1991 psychological horror film directed by Jonathan Demme and based on Thomas Harris' 1988 novel of the same name. The film stars Jodie Foster as Clarice Starling, an FBI trainee who seeks the help of incarcerated serial killer Hannibal Lecter, played by Anthony Hopkins, to catch another serial killer known as Buffalo Bill. The Silence of the Lambs won five Academy Awards, including Best Picture, and is considered one of the greatest films in the horror genre.

title: The Departed
synopsis: The Departed is a 2006 crime film directed by Martin Scorsese and starring Leonardo DiCaprio, Matt Damon, and Jack Nicholson. The film is a remake of the 2002 Hong Kong film Infernal Affairs and follows an undercover cop and a mole in the police force who try to identify each other while infiltrating an Irish gang in Boston. The Departed won four Academy Awards, including Best Picture, and is known for its intense performances and gripping storyline.

title: Goodfellas
synopsis: Goodfellas is a 1990 crime film directed by Martin Scorsese and based on the 1985 non-fiction book Wiseguy by Nicholas Pileggi. The film stars Robert De Niro, Ray Liotta, and Joe Pesci, and follows the rise and fall of mob associate Henry Hill. Goodfellas is known for its realistic portrayal of organized crime and received critical acclaim for its performances, screenplay, and direction.

title: Schindler's List
synopsis: Schindler's List is a 1993 historical drama film directed by Steven Spielberg and based on the novel Schindler's Ark by Thomas Keneally. The film tells the true story of Oskar Schindler, a German businessman who saved the lives of more than a thousand Jewish refugees during the Holocaust. Schindler's List received widespread critical acclaim for its powerful storytelling, performances, and depiction of the Holocaust.

title: The Lion King
synopsis: The Lion King is a 1994 animated musical film produced by Walt Disney Feature Animation. It tells the story of Simba, a young lion who must reclaim his throne as king after his father, Mufasa, is murdered by his uncle, Scar. The Lion King is known for its memorable songs, stunning animation, and timeless story. It is considered one of Disney's greatest animated films.

title: The Avengers
synopsis: The Avengers is a 2012 superhero film directed by Joss Whedon and based on the Marvel Comics superhero team of the same name. The film features an ensemble cast including Robert Downey Jr., Chris Evans, Mark Ruffalo, Chris Hemsworth, Scarlett Johansson, and Jeremy Renner. The Avengers follows the team as they come together to stop Loki and his alien army from enslaving humanity. The film was a critical and commercial success, and spawned a successful franchise.

title: Titanic
synopsis: Titanic is a 1997 epic romance and disaster film directed by James Cameron. It stars Leonardo DiCaprio and Kate Winslet as members of different social classes who fall in love aboard the ill-fated RMS Titanic. The film depicts the tragic sinking of the ship and the impact it has on the lives of the passengers. Titanic received critical acclaim for its performances, visual effects, and emotional storytelling.

title: Jurassic Park
synopsis: Jurassic Park is a 1993 science fiction adventure film directed by Steven Spielberg and based on the 1990 novel of the same name by Michael Crichton. The film follows a group of scientists who are invited to preview a theme park populated with cloned dinosaurs. Jurassic Park is known for its groundbreaking visual effects and thrilling storyline. It was a commercial success and spawned a successful franchise.

title: The Social Network
synopsis: The Social Network is a 2010 biographical drama film directed by David Fincher and written by Aaron Sorkin. It stars Jesse Eisenberg as Mark Zuckerberg, the co-founder of Facebook, and depicts the founding of the social networking website and the subsequent legal battles. The Social Network received critical acclaim for its screenplay, direction, and performances.

title: The Dark Knight Rises
synopsis: The Dark Knight Rises is a 2012 superhero film directed by Christopher Nolan and the final installment in Nolan's Batman trilogy. It stars Christian Bale as Batman, alongside Tom Hardy as the villain Bane. The film follows Batman as he returns to Gotham City to protect it from Bane's plans for destruction. The Dark Knight Rises received positive reviews for its performances, action sequences, and thematic depth.

title: The Green Mile
synopsis: The Green Mile is a 1999 American fantasy crime drama film written and directed by Frank Darabont and based on Stephen King's 1996 novel of the same name. The film stars Tom Hanks as a death row corrections officer who witnesses supernatural events surrounding a mysterious inmate, played by Michael Clarke Duncan. The Green Mile received critical acclaim for its performances, screenplay, and emotional impact.
